metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3812 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An out-of-bounds memory access flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s TUN/TAPdevice driver functionality in how a user generates a malicious (too big)networking packet when napi frags is enabled. This flaw allows a local userto crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3812` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-206.217
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-206.217
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-206.217
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-206.217
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-206.217
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-139.156~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-139.156~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-206.217').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4, was needs-triage').
